pullRequest.body:
This is a sequel to #12147, adding the key properties of the even Hurwitz zeta function: it is differentiable away from s = 1, and it agrees with the Dirichlet series when the latter converges. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: For some reason the build is failing on CI, although it works fine on my system. Will investigate tomorrow.

LGTM.
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by MichaelStollBayreuth.

:v: loefflerd can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

bors r+

(I know it is normal to wait for CI to pass before sending a delegated PR to bors, but here, the only change since delegation is a one-word edit to a doc comment, so there is no possibility of CI not passing.)

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8961030280/job/24608192102)

I'm mystified why the bors run failed. I've just merged master and it builds both locally and in CI, so let's try again

bors r+
Maybe the "broken pipe" problem?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8965644109/job/24619525600)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8965644109/job/24619525966)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8965644109/job/24619526291)
bors d+
bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

```suggestion
  · simp only [ne_eq, div_eq_zero_iff, OfNat.ofNat_ne_zero, or_false]
    rcases hs with h | h
    · exact Or.inl h
    · simp only [hurwitzEvenFEPair, one_div, h, ↓reduceIte, or_true]
```
I think this reads a bit better (I find `eq_true_intro` and `eq_false_intro` somewhat suspicous).

```suggestion
  · exact div_ne_zero_iff.mpr ⟨hs, two_ne_zero⟩
```

A version of this occurs three times here. Maybe add a
```lean
lemma xyz {a : ℂ} (b : ℂ) (ha : a ≠ 0) : Tendsto (fun s : ℂ ↦ s / a) (𝓝[≠] b) (𝓝[≠] (b / a))
```
somewhere? (Or state it as a private lemma for `a = 2`.)
`with h` seems unnecessary.
This is [Complex.ne_zero_of_one_lt_re](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Complex/Abs.html#Complex.ne_zero_of_one_lt_re).
Hopefully this problem will go away once [lean4#3996](https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/issues/3996) has been dealt with.
I added a TODO note.

With the latest mathlib master, the `convert` is now fast again, so I have reinstated it (and removed the todo).

awaiting-review

This looks like [Complex.ne_zero_of_one_lt_re](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Complex/Abs.html#Complex.ne_zero_of_one_lt_re) again (there may be other instances I have overlooked...).
I fixed the two you found and one other – I think that's the lot.
See above.
Another one?
Are you planning to apply this to streamline something about Riemann zeta, or should one just change the docstring by replacing Riemann with Hurwitz?
Good point, that was unclear, I'll change it.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/LSeries): Even Hurwitz zeta functions (II)

source.title: Tracking issue for Hurwitz and Dirichlet L-series
